title: Home
text:
I am a postdoctoral fellow in Plant Sciences at the University of Saskatchewan. I currently lead the metagenomic and bioinformatic components of Grassland Genomics for Greenhouse Gas Mitigation (GG4GHG), a Genome Canada–funded program that investigates how plant genetic and species diversity, together with soil microbial and insect communities, shapes carbon storage, greenhouse gas mitigation potential, and other ecosystem services in Canadian grasslands.









Research vision
My research is driven by a central question: what do plants, microbes, and viruses do in concert with one another, and how do these interactions shape biological function and environmental outcomes?
I am particularly interested in the functional genetics of microbial life in ecological contexts where they interact to influence plant performance and broader ecosystem processes. My focus is using functional genomics to understand how biological interactions are encoded, regulated, and expressed across interacting plant–microbe–virus systems.





Core research areas
Microbial ecology. Investigation of bacterial and fungal community dynamics in soil and plant-associated environments through a range of molecular and bioinformatic practices.
Viral ecology. Examination of viruses as integral components of the soil ecosystem, focusing on how viral infection, lifestyle, and host interactions influence microbial function, community dynamics, and cross-kingdom feedbacks in environmental systems.
Epigenetics and functional regulation. How does epigenetics contribute to functional differentiation in host-associated and environmental systems, particularly in the context of plant–microbe interactions and environmental stresses.



Current external collaborations
CAT-G Genome Canada: Contributing genomic and integrative analyses to support cross-platform and cross-system synthesis within the Genome Canada ICT’s, funded through the CS-DCC.

title: CV
text:
Employment

University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Canada
Postdoctoral Fellow (2024–Present)

Led integrative analyses linking plant productivity, soil microbial communities, and ecosystem function in Canadian grasslands.
Developed and maintained bioinformatic pipelines for processing large-scale genomic sequencing datasets.
Coordinated province-wide data collection and management as part of Genome Canada-funded research.
Contributed to collaborative scientific publications, grant writing and reporting, and interdisciplinary research outputs.
Mentored and supervised undergraduate and graduate students.



Australian Genome Research Facility, Brisbane, Australia
I&D Scientist (2023–2024)

Identified and implemented new protocols, with a focus on long-read sequencing platforms.
Developed costings and supported financial decisions regarding cost recovery.
Monitored technical advancements and developed opportunities for new services and efficiency improvements.
Implemented bioinformatic analysis pipelines, focusing on microbial, metagenomic, and pan-genomic tools.
Worked with external collaborators to identify research projects with ongoing service potential.
Presented at scientific conferences.

Technical Officer (2022–2023)

Managed projects spanning library preparation, sequencing, and delivery of PacBio data and analyses to clients.
Pioneered AWS infrastructure for cloud-based processing of long-read bioinformatic analyses.
Produced client-facing reports and SOPs; supported project design and communication.
Trained new staff to proficiency aligned with SOPs and NATA accreditation guidelines.

Senior Laboratory Technician, Custom SNP Genotyping (2021–2022)

Designed and analysed custom SNP genotyping panels on the Agena MassARRAY platform.
Spearheaded introduction of qPCR and TaqMan assays as a commercial service.

Laboratory Technician, Sanger Sequencing (2018–2021)
